poem:
**The Stream of Arrogance**

The Thames rushes,  
banks swollen with greed—  
bonuses float  
on a current of debt.

Lenders sigh,  
wading through  
silt and promise,  
calculating loss  
in exchange for time,  
while silence trickles  
from courtrooms,  
echoing down  
shadowed corridors  
of power.  
  
The river's burden  
remains—  
unquenchable.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Thames Water’s arrogance over retention bonuses is breathtaking | Nils Pratley The attempt to restructure Thames Water’s waterlogged balance sheet is a complex and time-consuming undertaking, we can all agree. Current lenders will have to agree to write off many billions of pounds’ worth of debt, or have the pain forced upon them. Courts have to sanction the main steps. There is a risk (still) that the whole thing falls apart. But one aspect should". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
